org.gearvrf

Class GVRHybridObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRBaseShaderManager, GVRCamera, GVRCameraRig, GVREyePointee, GVREyePointeeHolder, GVRMaterial, GVRMaterialMap, GVRMesh, GVRPostEffect, GVRPostEffectMap, GVRRenderData, GVRScene, GVRSceneObject, GVRTexture, GVRTransform

    public abstract class GVRHybridObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Root of the GVRF object hierarchy. Descendant classes all have native (JNI) implementations; this base class manages the native lifecycles.

      • close

        public final void close()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Close this object, releasing any native resources. Most objects will be automatically closed when Java's garbage collector detects that they are no longer being used: Explicitly closing an object that's still linked into the scene graph will almost certainly crash your GVRF app. You should only close() transient objects (especially those that use lots of memory, like large textures) that you know are no longer being used.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        2.0.0
